Teacher Certification and Licensure: Education offers initial teacher certification programs that meet the standards set by the Maryland State Department of Education (MSDE) and the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP). Teacher certification programs are completed in conjunction with undergraduate majors and may require coursework in the major field beyond the major requirements. Teacher candidates at UMBC who complete a certification program and pass the tests and performance assessments outlined by MSDE are recommended to Maryland State Department of Education for licensure by the UMBC Education Department.  More information about MDSE testing requirements can be found here:

Completion of Minimum University Require: Minimum 120 credits and minimum GPA of 2.0
Completion of 45 upper-level credits, residence requirement, Writing Intensive requirement, and General Education requirement

Program Requirements: Minimum grade of 'C' in courses applied to the program

Complete the following:: EDUC 412 - Analysis of Teaching and Learning (3)
EDUC 417 - Processes and Acquisition of Reading (3)
EDUC 420 - Teaching Mathematics in the Elementary School (3)
EDUC 421 - Teaching Science in the Elementary School (3)
EDUC 422 - Social Studies in the Elementary School (3)
EDUC 452 - Student Teaching in the Elementary Schools (10)

General Education Courses (31 credits): Complete the following General Education courses. These courses may fulfill the student's GEP requirements for the bachelor's degree.

Complete the following:: MATH 131 - Mathematics for Elementary and Middle Grades Teachers I (4)
MATH 132 - Mathematics for Elementary and Middle Grades Teachers II (4)
STAT 121 - Introduction to Statistics for the Social Sciences (4)
One additional biological science or physical science course

Fine Arts/Literature: Complete two courses in art, dance, music, film/video, theatre or literature, including a maximum of 3 credits in literature.
